page.title: 14Old Railway Path/Darras Hall
page.content:
During the summer months, the old track appears to carry more traffic than the trains ever did. It was found over 60% of local residents use the path at least once a week. Whole families can be seen jogging, walking the dog or taking a 'short-cut' to the local shops. Horse riders from local stables exercise their horses along the track, which is a bridleway also, at all times of the year.
"After breakfast I had to put on my jods,gloves and riding hat. Then we went to the riding stables. I rode a little horse called Scoot. A man held onto the leading rein. First we walked then we trotted but I trotted while the others were cantering."
{ Madeleine,7 yrs
